change.item: Collection level finding aid created by Sheri Sarnoff

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains the account book of a 19th century shoemaker and leather dealer near Taunton, Massachusetts.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Abraham Hathaway was a shoemaker and leather dealer near Taunton, Massachusetts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Abraham Hathawayâ€™s account book.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Abraham Hathaway Papers, 1825-1870. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Hathaway Papers).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from an unknown dealer in 1966.
